013package org.apache.juneau.bean.html5;
014
015import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
016import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
017
018/**
019 * DTO for an HTML <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/text-level-semantics.html#the-bdi-element">&lt;bdi&gt;</a>
020 * element.
021 *
022 * <p>
023 * The bdi element represents a span of text that is to be isolated from its surroundings for the
024 * purposes of bidirectional text formatting. It is used to handle text that might be in a different
025 * direction than the surrounding text, such as user-generated content in a different language or
026 * script. The bdi element ensures that the text inside it is formatted correctly regardless of the
027 * directionality of the surrounding content.
028 *
029 * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
030 * <p class='bcode w800'>
031 *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.bean.html5.HtmlBuilder.*;
032 * 
033 *    <jc>// User comment in Arabic</jc>
034 *    Bdi <jv>arabic</jv> = <jsm>bdi</jsm>(<js>"مرحبا بالعالم"</js>);
035 * 
036 *    <jc>// Hebrew text in English context</jc>
037 *    Bdi <jv>hebrew</jv> = <jsm>bdi</jsm>(<js>"שלום עולם"</js>);
038 * 
039 *    <jc>// Mixed direction text</jc>
040 *    Bdi <jv>mixed</jv> = <jsm>bdi</jsm>(<js>"Hello "</js>, <jsm>bdi</jsm>(<js>"مرحبا"</js>), <js>" World"</js>);
041 * 
042 *    <jc>// User-generated content</jc>
043 *    Bdi <jv>userContent</jv> = <jsm>bdi</jsm>(<js>"This is a comment in Arabic: مرحبا"</js>)
044 *       ._class(<js>"user-comment"</js>);
045 * 
046 *    <jc>// Names in different scripts</jc>
047 *    Bdi <jv>name</jv> = <jsm>bdi</jsm>(<js>"محمد أحمد"</js>);
048 * 
049 *    <jc>// Numbers in different scripts</jc>
050 *    Bdi <jv>numbers</jv> = <jsm>bdi</jsm>(<js>"١٢٣٤٥"</js>);
051 * 
052 *    <jc>// Styled bidirectional text</jc>
053 *    Bdi <jv>styled</jv> = <jsm>bdi</jsm>(<js>"نص باللغة العربية"</js>)
054 *       ._class(<js>"bidi-text"</js>)
055 *       .style(<js>"direction: rtl;"</js>);
056 * </p>
057 *
058 * <p>
059 * The following convenience methods are provided for constructing instances of this bean:
060 * <ul class='javatree'>
061 *    <li class='jc'>{@link HtmlBuilder}
062 *    <ul class='javatree'>
063 *       <li class='jm'>{@link HtmlBuilder#bdi() bdi()}
064 *       <li class='jm'>{@link HtmlBuilder#bdi(Object, Object...) bdi(Object, Object...)}
065 *    </ul>
066 * </ul>
067 * </p>
068 *
069 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
070 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauBeanHtml5">juneau-bean-html5</a>
071 * </ul>
072 */
073@Bean(typeName="bdi")
074@FluentSetters
075public class Bdi extends HtmlElementText {
076
077   /**
078    * Creates an empty {@link Bdi} element.
079    */
080   public Bdi() {}
081
082   /**
083    * Creates a {@link Bdi} element with the specified {@link Bdi#text(Object)} node.
084    *
085    * @param text The {@link Bdi#text(Object)} node.
086    */
087   public Bdi(Object text) {
088      text(text);
089   }
090
091   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
092   // Overridden methods
093   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
094
095   // <FluentSetters>

099      super._class(value);
100      return this;
101   }
